data.title: Famous Georgian Singers
data.meta_description: The World would have been much poorer without these famous Georgian Singers!
data.text:
1

Katie Melua

(British-Georgian singer-songwriter)

23

3

Birthdate: September 16, 1984

Sun Sign: Virgo

Birthplace: Kutaisi

Katie Melua is a British singer and songwriter known for her mezzo-soprano vocal range. Managed by composer Mike Batt, she gained fame after signing with the Dramatico record label. Melua's debut album, "Call Off the Search," topped the UK charts and sold 1.8 million copies within five months of its release. Her second album, "Piece by Piece," achieved platinum status four times. She continued her success with the release of her third studio album, "Pictures." Melua's wealth reached £18 million, making her one of the wealthiest British musicians under 30.

2

Tamta

(Singer)

12

7

Birthdate: January 10, 1981

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Tamta Goduadze, known as Tamta, is a talented Georgian-born Greek singer who gained recognition in Greece in 2004 through her participation in Super Idol Greece, where she finished as a runner-up. She has since released successful albums and singles in Greece and Cyprus, establishing herself as a prominent figure in the music industry. Tamta has also showcased her expertise as a mentor on popular talent shows like X Factor Georgia and The X Factor Greece. In 2019, she represented Cyprus in the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "Replay", achieving a respectable 13th place.

3

Nina Sublatti

(Singer)

5

1

Birthdate: January 31, 1995

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Birthplace: Moscow, Russia

Nina Sublatti is a versatile talent known for her work as a singer, songwriter, and model. She gained international recognition by representing Georgia in the Eurovision Song Contest 2015 with her song "Warrior", achieving 11th place. Sublatti's musical journey includes winning the 2013 season of the Georgian version of Idols, and later serving as a judge on both X Factor Georgia and the Georgian Idols. With a strong presence in the music industry, Sublatti continues to captivate audiences with her artistry and contributions to the entertainment world.

Recommended Lists:

4

Vakhtang Kikabidze

(Singer)

5

1

Birthdate: July 19, 1938

Sun Sign: Cancer

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Vakhtang Kikabidze was a versatile talent who excelled in various fields of the entertainment industry. As an actor, singer, screenwriter, producer, and composer, he left a lasting impact on Soviet and Georgian cinema and music. His contributions to film and music were widely acclaimed, and he was known for his charismatic performances and memorable compositions. Additionally, Kikabidze ventured into politics and served in the Parliament of Georgia, showcasing his commitment to public service and his multi-faceted career.

5

Tamara Gverdtsiteli

(Singer)

5

1

Birthdate: January 18, 1962

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Tamara Gverdtsiteli is a versatile singer, actress, and composer with a distinguished career spanning Georgian, Israeli, Soviet, and Russian entertainment industries. She has garnered acclaim as a People's Artist of Georgia and Russia for her exceptional contributions to music and performing arts. Known for her powerful vocals and emotive performances, Gverdtsiteli has captivated audiences with her unique talent and artistic expression. Throughout her professional life, she has established herself as a prominent figure in the world of music and theater, leaving a lasting impact on the industry.

6

Sofia Nizharadze

(Singer)

4

1

Birthdate: February 6, 1985

Sun Sign: Aquarius

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Sofia Nizharadze is a multi-talented Georgian singer, actress, and songwriter known for her participation in the Eurovision Song Contest 2010 with the song "Shine". She has also showcased her expertise as a judge on popular TV shows like 'Georgia's Got Talent', 'Only Georgian', and 'The X Factor Georgia'. Nizharadze's professional career is marked by her exceptional musical abilities, stage presence, and contributions to the entertainment industry, making her a prominent figure in the Georgian music and television scene.

7

Bera Ivanishvili

(Singer)

11

2

Birthdate: December 23, 1994

Sun Sign: Capricorn

Birthplace: Paris, France

Bera Ivanishvili, known professionally as Bera, is a versatile artist with a thriving career as a singer, rapper, songwriter, record producer, and entrepreneur. He has successfully established himself in the music industries of both Georgia and the United States. Bera is also the founder of the Georgian record label and production studio, Georgian Dream. His talent and entrepreneurial spirit have played a significant role in shaping his professional journey, leading to his success and recognition in the music business.

8

Natia Todua

(Singer)

3

1

Birthdate: March 12, 1996

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Natia Todua is a talented Georgian-German singer who gained recognition by winning the seventh season of The Voice of Germany. Following her success on the show, she became a judge on the Georgian edition of Idol in 2018. Todua's career has been marked by her powerful vocals and stage presence, solidifying her reputation as a prominent figure in the music industry. Through her participation in these popular TV competitions, she has showcased her musical abilities and captivated audiences with her performances.

9

Nino Machaidze

(Singer)

3

1

Birthdate: March 8, 1983

Sun Sign: Pisces

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Nino Machaidze is a renowned Georgian operatic soprano known for her performances in 19th-century Romantic repertoire, particularly in operas by Rossini, Verdi, and French composers. She started her career at La Scala and gained international acclaim for her portrayal of Juliette in Gounod's Roméo et Juliette at the 2008 Salzburg Festival. Machaidze received the moniker "Angelina Jolie of Opera" from the Austrian press, reflecting her captivating stage presence and vocal talent that have established her as a prominent figure in the opera world.

10

Hamlet Gonashvili

(Singer)

2

0

Birthdate: June 20, 1928

Sun Sign: Gemini

Birthplace: Anaga, Kakheti, Georgia

Died: July 25, 1985

Hamlet Gonashvili, known as "the voice of Georgia," was a highly respected Georgian singer, influential teacher, and performer of Georgian folk music. He was renowned for his interpretation of songs from the Kartli and Kakheti regions and received numerous national honors and prizes for his contributions to music. Gonashvili's singing inspired the Third Symphony of Georgian composer Giya Kancheli, and he was the soloist in the first recording of the work. His professional career was tragically cut short in 1985 when he passed away due to a fall from an apple tree.

11

Lizi Pop

(Singer)

2

0

Birthdate: September 19, 2003

Sun Sign: Virgo

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Lizi Pop, also known as Liza Japaridze, is a multi-talented Georgian artist with a diverse professional portfolio. She is a singer, actress, model, dancer, and television presenter. Lizi represented Georgia in the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2014 in Malta and co-hosted the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2017 in Tbilisi. Her career showcases her versatility and ability to excel in various entertainment fields, making her a prominent figure in the Georgian entertainment industry.

12

Keti Topuria

(Singer)

5

1

Birthdate: September 9, 1986

Sun Sign: Virgo

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Keti Topuria is a talented Russian-Georgian singer known for her role as the lead vocalist of the Kazakhstani group A-Studio. With a strong presence in the music industry, she has captivated audiences with her powerful vocals and stage performances. Keti's professional journey is marked by her dedication to music and her ability to connect with fans through her distinctive style. Her contribution to A-Studio has further solidified her reputation as a respected and accomplished artist in the music scene.

13

Anita Rachvelishvili

(Singer)

5

1

Birthdate: June 28, 1984

Sun Sign: Cancer

Birthplace: Tbilisi, Georgia

Anita Rachvelishvili, a Georgian operatic mezzo-soprano, is renowned for her exceptional performances in Verdi's works, earning praise as the best Verdi mezzo-soprano globally by conductor Riccardo Muti. She is also celebrated for her portrayal of Bizet's Carmen. Rachvelishvili's unique dramatic presence, characterized by intense eyes and a fiery yet inward-focused quality, sets her apart. Making history, she became the youngest singer to open a season at La Scala. With critical acclaim and accolades, she has solidified her position at the pinnacle of her profession.

14

Diana Gurtskaya

(Singer)

3

2

Birthdate: July 2, 1978

Sun Sign: Cancer

Birthplace: Sukhumi, Abkhaz ASSR, Georgia

Diana Gurtskaya is a prominent Russian pop singer recognized for her talent across the former Soviet Union. With a career spanning years, she has achieved significant success in the music industry. Known for her powerful vocals and captivating performances, Gurtskaya has released numerous hit songs that have resonated with audiences. Her musical prowess and unique style have garnered her a loyal fan base, establishing her as a respected figure in the realm of pop music in the region.
